meanings.definition: The process of decay or damage caused by living organisms, such as bacteria or fungi.
meanings.sent1: Biodeterioration can be seen in the rotting wood outside.
meanings.sent2: The biodeterioration of the fruit was evident from the mold growing on it.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was ruined by the biodeterioration of the sandwiches.
meanings.sent4: The biodeterioration of the old books was like a slow, silent invasion.
meanings.sent5: The farmer explained how biodeterioration affected his crops, painting a vivid picture of decay.

meanings.definition: The gradual degradation or deterioration of materials due to biological factors.
meanings.sent1: We observed biodeterioration on the wooden fence in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The biodeterioration of the metal gate was caused by rust and corrosion.
meanings.sent3: The biodeterioration of the playground equipment made it unsafe for children.
meanings.sent4: The biodeterioration of the fabric was like a slow unraveling of threads.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed artifacts damaged by biodeterioration, showcasing the impact of time and nature.
